# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, rstrip(current_line))
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, rstrip(current_line))  # Add the last line
    return join(lines, '\n')
end

# Example usage:
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla euismod, lorem et mollis lacinia."
println(wrap_string(s))
```
In this example, the `wrap_string` function is used to wrap a long string `s` into lines with a maximum length of 10 characters. The wrapped lines are then printed out.
